description: A CLI that generates beautiful README.md files

description: A standard README style specification. Has a generator to help create spec-compliant READMEs, too.

name: Zalando's README Template
description: Simple template to help you cover all the basics.

name: Gifox
description: $4.99 - Cleanest UI, hotkeys, lots of advanced features

name: Gifski
description: FREE - More vivid colors than the rest, but still keep size low

name: Giphy Capture
description: FREE - Easy to upload to giphy.com, slightly annoying UX.

name: LICEcap
description: FREE - Less intuitive, more features

name: Peek
description: FREE - Simple and easy to use for Linux users.

name: Recordit
description: FREE - Simple, clean UI, but auto-uploads to recordit.co

name: ScreenToGif
description: FREE - Open source, customizable UI and easily editable GIFs, easy to get started.

name: terminalizer
description: FREE - Record your terminal and generate animated gif images or share a web player

name: ttystudio
description: FREE - For commandline tools, a terminal-to-gif recorder minus the headaches.

name: feedmereadmes
description: Free README editing+feedback to make your open-source projects grow. See the README maturity model to help you keep going.

name: maintainer.io
description: Free README standardization and feedback, if you click on 'Book an audit'.
